intro: Pimpinella poteriifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf cowparsnip, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. The plant features large, pinnately compound leaves with serrated margins, and its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, and it is often found in temperate climates. The plant contains compounds that can be toxic if ingested, though it is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
